summary: This document is a chain of emails from June 27, 2020, discussing an investigation into threatening emails sent to an individual. The emails detail emergency disclosure requests to Google to trace the threats, which originated from IP addresses in Iran and used CDNs to mask location. The investigation was closed as the threat deadline passed without incident, and the recipient was criticized for not following advice.

persons.name: MI=IMIMI=>
persons.context: Appears as the sender of a threatening email demanding bitcoin and threatening violence against a child.

events.title: Threatening Email Deadline Passes
events.description: A threat was posted at 0647 hours with an 8-hour deadline (1447 hours) demanding 2.5 bitcoins; the deadline passed without incident.

events.title: Google Emergency Disclosure Request
events.description: An emergency disclosure request to Google revealed IP activity from Iran and CDN-masked locations in New York and California.

keyFacts: Threatening emails demanded 2.5 bitcoins and threatened violence against a child, with the sender claiming to be in New York and Iran.
IP trace results showed logins from Iran and CDN-masked IPs in New York and California, suggesting attempts to mask the sender's location.
The investigation was closed as the threat deadline passed without incident, and resources were deemed wasted due to the recipient not following advice.
The recipient and their lawyer had been notified to cease communications but continued, leading to further threats.
A previous similar threat led to increased police patrols around a residence, but no incident occurred.
